title: Morpho catenarius
text:
Morpho catenarius is a <a href="Neotropical">Neotropical</a> butterfly belonging to the subfamily <a href="Morphinae">Morphinae</a> of the family <a href="Nymphalidae">Nymphalidae</a>. It is considered, by some authors, to be a <a href="subspecies">subspecies</a> of "<a href="Morpho%20epistrophus">Morpho epistrophus</a>".
Description.
"Morpho catenarius" has a <a href="wingspan">wingspan</a> of about . This species lacks the usual bright blue coloration of many "Morpho" species. The translucent surfaces of the wings vary from a pale blue color to almost white. The edges of the wings show a series of black spots, while the hindwings are crossed by several small "<a href="eyespot%20%28mimicry%29">eyes</a>". Larvae feed on "<a href="Scutia%20buxifolia">Scutia buxifolia</a>" (<a href="Rhamnaceae">Rhamnaceae</a>) and other plant species in the families <a href="Erythroxylaceae">Erythroxylaceae</a>, <a href="Leguminosae">Leguminosae</a>, <a href="Sapindaceae">Sapindaceae</a> and <a href="Euphorbiaceae">Euphorbiaceae</a>. 
Distribution.
This species is found in <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a> (Minas Gerais, São Paulo).
